sentences: Ta peab maksma alimendid oma lapse eest.
Alimendid võivad sisaldada ka raha laste kasvatamiseks.
context: The word 'lapse' is the genitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'laps', meaning 'child'. In this context, it appears in phrases related to child maintenance or financial support obligations. The genitive case shows possession or relationship - so 'lapse ülalpidamine' means 'maintenance for/of a child' and 'oma lapse eest' means 'for one's own child'. This form is commonly used in legal contexts concerning parental responsibilities.
